title: Data roaming off, but Pixel (2&3) still lets some data through, causing high charges.
content:
I travel across the border (Russia -> Finland) several times per week. To avoid international data roaming charges, I have the data roaming option set to OFF always. If I don't, I get charged ~$5/day.

But I still get charged the $5/day. I get an SMS from my home carrier saying "You started using data abroad, we've charged you $5". And I didn't! When I check the bill, it's 2Kb or 4Kb. Someone on Reddit suggested that I need to disable "Unlimited access" for Carrier Services and Google Play Store.

Data Roaming Off should mean OFF! Why is my phone still leaking data?
